titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kate Conger Baker booklet 1985.041
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-31 18:24:20 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A bound paperback of the booklet "'Common-Sense' in the Farm-house and Young Mothers' Assistant," written by Brooklynite Kate Conger Baker and published in 1882. The booklet is essentially a cookbook, containing basic recipes for a variety of dishes, including salads, appetizers, main courses, baked goods, and desserts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Kate Conger Baker (1832-1907) was an author and homemaker who lived in Brooklyn and Great Neck, Long Island.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kate Conger Baker booklet, 1882, 1985.041, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A bound paperback of the booklet "'Common-Sense' in the Farm-house and Young Mothers' Assistant," written by Brooklynite Kate Conger Baker and published in 1882. The booklet is essentially a cookbook, containing basic recipes for a variety of dishes, including salads, appetizers, main courses, baked goods, and desserts.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
